      • MyHTTPReply

        public MyHTTPReply(MyHTTPProtocolException e,
                   java.lang.String version)
        Construct a basic HTTPReply based on an exception generated by an incoming request (I.E. bad syntax).
        Parameters:
        e - the MyHTTPProtocolException object that was thrown
        version - of the HTTP protocol in use

      • MyHTTPReply

        public MyHTTPReply(java.lang.String statusLine,
                   java.lang.String header,
                   java.lang.String data)
            throws HTTPProtocolException
        Construct an HTTPReply object bouncing parameters to the superclass constructor.
        Parameters:
        statusLine - of the response
        header - a String object containing the whole lot of header lines
        data - the body of the message
        Throws:
        HTTPProtocolException - if input parameters could not be parsed
